nodes.bodyText:
Update

An empty header name was found while parsing the '{0}' configuration. This value will be ignored.

to

An empty header name was found when the '{0}' configuration was parsed. This value is ignored.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -176,4 +176,16 @@ cookies.samesite.unsupportedWildcard.useraction=Ensure that only a single wildca
 
 cookies.samesite.knownDuplicateName=CWWKT0037W: A cookie name or pattern [{0}], which is marked as a duplicate, was found in the SameSite [{1}] configuration. The [{0}] cookie name or pattern is ignored. Any cookie name or pattern that is defined by the 'lax', 'none', and 'strict' configurations can be defined in only one of the three configurations. 
 cookies.samesite.knownDuplicateName.explanation=The specified value was already found by the configuration and mapped to a SameSite value.
-cookies.samesite.knownDuplicateName.useraction=Ensure that cookie names and patterns are unique across the 'lax', 'none', and 'strict' configuration lists.
\ No newline at end of file
+cookies.samesite.knownDuplicateName.useraction=Ensure that cookie names and patterns are unique across the 'lax', 'none', and 'strict' configuration lists.
+
+headers.emptyName=CWWKT0038W: An empty header name was found while parsing the '{0}' configuration. This value will be ignored.

nodes.bodyText:
Update

A duplicate header name was found in the header [{0}] using the 'set' configuration. All configurations for the [{0}] header will be ignored. Any header defined by the 'set' configuration must contain unique header names.

to

A duplicate header name was found in the [{0}] header using the 'set' configuration. All configurations for the [{0}] header are ignored. Any header that is defined by the 'set' configuration must contain unique header names.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -176,4 +176,16 @@ cookies.samesite.unsupportedWildcard.useraction=Ensure that only a single wildca
 
 cookies.samesite.knownDuplicateName=CWWKT0037W: A cookie name or pattern [{0}], which is marked as a duplicate, was found in the SameSite [{1}] configuration. The [{0}] cookie name or pattern is ignored. Any cookie name or pattern that is defined by the 'lax', 'none', and 'strict' configurations can be defined in only one of the three configurations. 
 cookies.samesite.knownDuplicateName.explanation=The specified value was already found by the configuration and mapped to a SameSite value.
-cookies.samesite.knownDuplicateName.useraction=Ensure that cookie names and patterns are unique across the 'lax', 'none', and 'strict' configuration lists.
\ No newline at end of file
+cookies.samesite.knownDuplicateName.useraction=Ensure that cookie names and patterns are unique across the 'lax', 'none', and 'strict' configuration lists.
+
+headers.emptyName=CWWKT0038W: An empty header name was found while parsing the '{0}' configuration. This value will be ignored.
+headers.emptyName.explanation=The specified header's name is an empty string. A header name must not be empty. 
+headers.emptyName.useraction=Ensure that no header name is empty.  
+
+headers.duplicateHeaderName=CWWKT0039W: A duplicate header name was found in the header [{0}] using the 'set' configuration. All configurations for the [{0}] header will be ignored. Any header defined by the 'set' configuration must contain unique header names.

nodes.bodyText:
Update

The specified header name was already found by the 'set' and/or 'add' configurations.

to

The specified header name was already found by the 'set' or 'add' configurations.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -176,4 +176,16 @@ cookies.samesite.unsupportedWildcard.useraction=Ensure that only a single wildca
 
 cookies.samesite.knownDuplicateName=CWWKT0037W: A cookie name or pattern [{0}], which is marked as a duplicate, was found in the SameSite [{1}] configuration. The [{0}] cookie name or pattern is ignored. Any cookie name or pattern that is defined by the 'lax', 'none', and 'strict' configurations can be defined in only one of the three configurations. 
 cookies.samesite.knownDuplicateName.explanation=The specified value was already found by the configuration and mapped to a SameSite value.
-cookies.samesite.knownDuplicateName.useraction=Ensure that cookie names and patterns are unique across the 'lax', 'none', and 'strict' configuration lists.
\ No newline at end of file
+cookies.samesite.knownDuplicateName.useraction=Ensure that cookie names and patterns are unique across the 'lax', 'none', and 'strict' configuration lists.
+
+headers.emptyName=CWWKT0038W: An empty header name was found while parsing the '{0}' configuration. This value will be ignored.
+headers.emptyName.explanation=The specified header's name is an empty string. A header name must not be empty. 
+headers.emptyName.useraction=Ensure that no header name is empty.  
+
+headers.duplicateHeaderName=CWWKT0039W: A duplicate header name was found in the header [{0}] using the 'set' configuration. All configurations for the [{0}] header will be ignored. Any header defined by the 'set' configuration must contain unique header names.
+headers.duplicateHeaderName.explanation=The specified header name was already found by the 'set' and/or 'add' configurations.

nodes.bodyText:
Update

Ensure that header names defined on 'set' configuration are unique across the 'add' and 'set' configurations.

to

Ensure that header names that are defined in the 'set' configuration are unique across the 'add' and 'set' configurations.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -176,4 +176,16 @@ cookies.samesite.unsupportedWildcard.useraction=Ensure that only a single wildca
 
 cookies.samesite.knownDuplicateName=CWWKT0037W: A cookie name or pattern [{0}], which is marked as a duplicate, was found in the SameSite [{1}] configuration. The [{0}] cookie name or pattern is ignored. Any cookie name or pattern that is defined by the 'lax', 'none', and 'strict' configurations can be defined in only one of the three configurations. 
 cookies.samesite.knownDuplicateName.explanation=The specified value was already found by the configuration and mapped to a SameSite value.
-cookies.samesite.knownDuplicateName.useraction=Ensure that cookie names and patterns are unique across the 'lax', 'none', and 'strict' configuration lists.
\ No newline at end of file
+cookies.samesite.knownDuplicateName.useraction=Ensure that cookie names and patterns are unique across the 'lax', 'none', and 'strict' configuration lists.
+
+headers.emptyName=CWWKT0038W: An empty header name was found while parsing the '{0}' configuration. This value will be ignored.
+headers.emptyName.explanation=The specified header's name is an empty string. A header name must not be empty. 
+headers.emptyName.useraction=Ensure that no header name is empty.  
+
+headers.duplicateHeaderName=CWWKT0039W: A duplicate header name was found in the header [{0}] using the 'set' configuration. All configurations for the [{0}] header will be ignored. Any header defined by the 'set' configuration must contain unique header names.

+headers.duplicateHeaderName.useraction=Ensure that header names defined on 'set' configuration are unique across the 'add' and 'set' configurations.

nodes.bodyText:
Update

The header [{0}], which is marked as duplicate header name, was found in the 'set' configuration. The [{0}] header is ignored. Any header defined by the 'set' configuration must contain unique header names.

to

The [{0}] header, which is marked as a duplicate header name, was found in the 'set' configuration. The [{0}] header is ignored. Any header that is defined by the 'set' configuration must contain unique header names.

beforeCommit.message: Initial commit: response header configuration support core code

afterCommit.message: Initial commit: response header configuration support core code

nodes.bodyText:
Update

Headers to be added on each responses

to

Headers to be added on each response
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -232,4 +239,10 @@ http.samesite.none=List of samesite none cookies
 http.samesite.none.desc=List of cookie names or patterns for which the SameSite attribute is set to a value of None, if not already defined. A single wildcard (*) character is supported as a stand-alone value, or following cookie name prefixes. Any cookie name or pattern that is defined by this list must be unique and not present in the 'lax' nor 'strict' configurations. Each cookie that is modified to contain a SameSite value of None as a result of this configuration is also set to Secure.
 
 http.samesite.strict=List of samesite strict cookies
-http.samesite.strict.desc=List of cookie names or patterns for which the SameSite attribute is set to a value of Strict, if not already defined. A single wildcard (*) character is supported as a stand-alone value, or following cookie name prefixes. Any cookie name or pattern that is defined by this list must be unique and not present in the 'lax' nor 'none' configurations.
\ No newline at end of file
+http.samesite.strict.desc=List of cookie names or patterns for which the SameSite attribute is set to a value of Strict, if not already defined. A single wildcard (*) character is supported as a stand-alone value, or following cookie name prefixes. Any cookie name or pattern that is defined by this list must be unique and not present in the 'lax' nor 'none' configurations.
+
+http.headers.add=Headers to be added on each responses

nodes.bodyText:
Update

Specifies the header names and values that will be added to each HTTP response. Header values are optionally included by using a colon (:) delimiter. Any header name defined using this attribute must not be empty.

to

Specifies the header names and values that are added to each HTTP response. Header values are optionally included by using a colon (:) delimiter. Any header name that is defined by using this attribute must not be empty.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -232,4 +239,10 @@ http.samesite.none=List of samesite none cookies
 http.samesite.none.desc=List of cookie names or patterns for which the SameSite attribute is set to a value of None, if not already defined. A single wildcard (*) character is supported as a stand-alone value, or following cookie name prefixes. Any cookie name or pattern that is defined by this list must be unique and not present in the 'lax' nor 'strict' configurations. Each cookie that is modified to contain a SameSite value of None as a result of this configuration is also set to Secure.
 
 http.samesite.strict=List of samesite strict cookies
-http.samesite.strict.desc=List of cookie names or patterns for which the SameSite attribute is set to a value of Strict, if not already defined. A single wildcard (*) character is supported as a stand-alone value, or following cookie name prefixes. Any cookie name or pattern that is defined by this list must be unique and not present in the 'lax' nor 'none' configurations.
\ No newline at end of file
+http.samesite.strict.desc=List of cookie names or patterns for which the SameSite attribute is set to a value of Strict, if not already defined. A single wildcard (*) character is supported as a stand-alone value, or following cookie name prefixes. Any cookie name or pattern that is defined by this list must be unique and not present in the 'lax' nor 'none' configurations.
+
+http.headers.add=Headers to be added on each responses
+http.headers.add.desc=Specifies the header names and values that will be added to each HTTP response. Header values are optionally included by using a colon (:) delimiter. Any header name defined using this attribute must not be empty.

nodes.bodyText:
Update

Specifies the header names and values that will be set to each HTTP response. Header values are optionally included by using a colon (:) delimiter. Any header name defined using this attribute must not be empty, unique, and not present in the 'add' header configuration.

to

Specifies the header names and values that are set to each HTTP response. Header values are optionally included by using a colon (:) delimiter. Any header name that is defined by using this attribute must not be empty or unique, and it must not present in the 'add' header configuration.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -232,4 +239,10 @@ http.samesite.none=List of samesite none cookies
 http.samesite.none.desc=List of cookie names or patterns for which the SameSite attribute is set to a value of None, if not already defined. A single wildcard (*) character is supported as a stand-alone value, or following cookie name prefixes. Any cookie name or pattern that is defined by this list must be unique and not present in the 'lax' nor 'strict' configurations. Each cookie that is modified to contain a SameSite value of None as a result of this configuration is also set to Secure.
 
 http.samesite.strict=List of samesite strict cookies
-http.samesite.strict.desc=List of cookie names or patterns for which the SameSite attribute is set to a value of Strict, if not already defined. A single wildcard (*) character is supported as a stand-alone value, or following cookie name prefixes. Any cookie name or pattern that is defined by this list must be unique and not present in the 'lax' nor 'none' configurations.
\ No newline at end of file
+http.samesite.strict.desc=List of cookie names or patterns for which the SameSite attribute is set to a value of Strict, if not already defined. A single wildcard (*) character is supported as a stand-alone value, or following cookie name prefixes. Any cookie name or pattern that is defined by this list must be unique and not present in the 'lax' nor 'none' configurations.
+
+http.headers.add=Headers to be added on each responses
+http.headers.add.desc=Specifies the header names and values that will be added to each HTTP response. Header values are optionally included by using a colon (:) delimiter. Any header name defined using this attribute must not be empty. 
+
+http.headers.set=Headers to be set on each response
+http.headers.set.desc=Specifies the header names and values that will be set to each HTTP response. Header values are optionally included by using a colon (:) delimiter. Any header name defined using this attribute must not be empty, unique, and not present in the 'add' header configuration.

nodes.bodyText: Suggestion: Replace "consider" with another verb, maybe "evaluate," "assess," "examine," or "access."  Normally, "consider" is something that humans/animals do.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -101,6 +105,9 @@ http.compression.desc=An element that is configured within the httpEndpoint elem
 http.samesite=SameSite Options
 http.samesite.desc=An element that is configured within the httpEndpoint element so that the associated HTTP channel can consider SameSite configurations.
 
+http.headers=Header Options
+http.headers.desc=An element that is configured within the httpEndpoint element so that the associated HTTP channel can consider response header configurations.

nodes.bodyText: Change "values will be" to "values are"
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -232,4 +239,16 @@ http.samesite.none=List of samesite none cookies
 http.samesite.none.desc=List of cookie names or patterns for which the SameSite attribute is set to a value of None, if not already defined. A single wildcard (*) character is supported as a stand-alone value, or following cookie name prefixes. Any cookie name or pattern that is defined by this list must be unique and not present in the 'lax' nor 'strict' configurations. Each cookie that is modified to contain a SameSite value of None as a result of this configuration is also set to Secure.
 
 http.samesite.strict=List of samesite strict cookies
-http.samesite.strict.desc=List of cookie names or patterns for which the SameSite attribute is set to a value of Strict, if not already defined. A single wildcard (*) character is supported as a stand-alone value, or following cookie name prefixes. Any cookie name or pattern that is defined by this list must be unique and not present in the 'lax' nor 'none' configurations.
\ No newline at end of file
+http.samesite.strict.desc=List of cookie names or patterns for which the SameSite attribute is set to a value of Strict, if not already defined. A single wildcard (*) character is supported as a stand-alone value, or following cookie name prefixes. Any cookie name or pattern that is defined by this list must be unique and not present in the 'lax' nor 'none' configurations.
+
+http.headers.add=Headers to be added on each response
+http.headers.add.desc=Specifies the header names and values that are added to each HTTP response. Header values are optionally included by using a colon (:) delimiter. Any header name that is defined by using this attribute must not be empty or present in the 'remove', 'set', or 'setIfMissing' header configurations. 
+
+http.headers.set=Headers to be set on each response
+http.headers.set.desc=Specifies the header names and values that are set to each HTTP response. Header values are optionally included by using a colon (:) delimiter. Any header name that is defined by using this attribute must not be empty, defined more than once, or present in the 'remove', 'add', or 'setIfEmpty'  header configurations. If the header is already present on the response, existing values will be overwritten in favor of this configuration.

nodes.bodyText: Remove the 's because it is not needed and it can adversely affect translation. Use "specified header name" instead.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -166,14 +166,26 @@ decompression.tolerance.reached=CWWKT0034E: The HTTP channel attempted to decomp
 decompression.tolerance.reached.explanation=The maximum number of decompression cycles has reached, resulting in a decompression ratio larger than the configured limit. The decompression limit is defined by the decompressionRatioLimit httpOption attribute.
 decompression.tolerance.reached.useraction=When this exception happens on a valid request body, reconfigure the decompressionTolerance and decompressionRatioLimit httpOption attributes to achieve the appropriate decompression results.
 
-cookies.samesite.duplicateName=CWWKT0035W: A duplicate cookie name or pattern [{0}] was found in the SameSite [{1}] configuration. The [{0}] cookie name or pattern is ignored for all configuration lists. The [{0}] cookie name or pattern is ignored for all configuration lists. Any cookie name or pattern that is defined by the ��lax��, ��none��, and ��strict�' configurations can be defined in only one of the three configurations.
 cookies.samesite.duplicateName.explanation=The specified value was already found by the configuration and mapped to a SameSite value.
 cookies.samesite.duplicateName.useraction=Ensure that cookie names and patterns are unique across the 'lax', 'none', and 'strict' configuration lists.
 
 cookies.samesite.unsupportedWildcard=CWWKT0036W: An unsupported use of the wildcard character was attempted by the value [{0}]. The SameSite configuration is not set for this value.
 cookies.samesite.unsupportedWildcard.explanation=The wildcard (*) character was used in an unsupported way. Support consists of a single wildcard (*) character that is used as a stand-alone value, or following any number of cookie name prefixes.
 cookies.samesite.unsupportedWildcard.useraction=Ensure that only a single wildcard (*) character is used per pattern in the 'lax', 'none', and 'strict' lists. Additionally, use of this character is supported only under the following two conditions: as a stand-alone value or following cookie name prefixes.

Additionally, use of this character is supported only under the following two conditions: as a stand-alone value or following cookie name prefixes.
 
-cookies.samesite.knownDuplicateName=CWWKT0037W: A cookie name or pattern [{0}], which is marked as a duplicate, was found in the SameSite [{1}] configuration. The [{0}] cookie name or pattern is ignored. Any cookie name or pattern that is defined by the ��lax��, ��none��, and ��strict�' configurations can be defined in only one of the three configurations.�
+cookies.samesite.knownDuplicateName=CWWKT0037W: A cookie name or pattern [{0}], which is marked as a duplicate, was found in the SameSite [{1}] configuration. The [{0}] cookie name or pattern is ignored. Any cookie name or pattern that is defined by the ��lax��, ��none��, and ��strict�' configurations can be defined in only one of the three configurations.�
 cookies.samesite.knownDuplicateName.explanation=The specified value was already found by the configuration and mapped to a SameSite value.
 cookies.samesite.knownDuplicateName.useraction=Ensure that cookie names and patterns are unique across the 'lax', 'none', and 'strict' configuration lists.
+
+headers.emptyName=CWWKT0038W: An empty header name was found when the '{0}' configuration was parsed. This value is ignored.
+headers.emptyName.explanation=The specified header's name is an empty string. A header name must not be empty. 
+headers.emptyName.useraction=Ensure that no header name is empty.  
+
+headers.duplicateHeaderName=CWWKT0039W: A duplicate header name was found in the [{0}] header using the '{1}' configuration. All configurations for the [{0}] header are ignored. Any header that is defined by the 'remove', 'add', 'set', or 'setIfMissing' configurations must be unique across all configurations.
+headers.duplicateHeaderName.explanation=The specified header name was previously configured by another configuration of the Headers feature.
+headers.duplicateHeaderName.useraction=Ensure that headers that are defined by the 'remove', 'add', 'set', or 'setIfMissing' configurations are no present in more than one configuration.

nodes.bodyText: Can you clean up the formatting here?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -88,9 +88,9 @@
             <Option label="%onError.ignore" value="IGNORE"/>   
         </AD>
 
-        <AD id="httpOptionsRef" name="%endpoint.httpOptions" description="%endpoint.httpOptions.desc"
-            ibm:reference="com.ibm.ws.http.options" ibm:type="pid"
-            type="String" required="false" default="defaultHttpOptions" />
+        <AD id="httpOptionsRef" name="%endpoint.httpOptions"
+	description="%endpoint.httpOptions.desc" ibm:reference="com.ibm.ws.http.options"
+	ibm:type="pid" type="String" required="false" default="defaultHttpOptions" />

nodes.bodyText: Formatting seems a bit odd here as well.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -123,6 +127,10 @@
 			ibm:final="true" required="false" type = "String"
 			default="(|(service.pid=${samesiteRef})(&(service.factoryPid=com.ibm.ws.http.samesite)(|(id=com.ibm.ws.http-${id}/*)(id=defaultSameSite))))" />
     
+    	<AD id="headers.target" name="internal" description="internal use only"
+			ibm:final="true" required="false" type = "String" ibm:beta="true"
+			default="(|(service.pid=${headersRef})(&(service.factoryPid=com.ibm.ws.http.headers)(|(id=com.ibm.ws.http-${id}/*)(id=defaultHeaders))))" />

nodes.bodyText: I'm not a huge fan of having the word feature in this naming convention. Can you work to come up with a better name here?
Any reason you use append here rather than add?
Please fix the formatting here.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -87,7 +88,8 @@
                 WCSendRedirectRelativeURLTrue.class,
                 WCSendRedirectRelativeURLDefault.class,
                 WC5GetContextPath.class,
-                WCSCIHandlesTypesTest.class
+                WCSCIHandlesTypesTest.class,
+		 WCResponseHeadersTest.class

nodes.bodyText: Add check to ensure savedConfig isn't null? What happens if it is null?
Perhaps use a methodName variable here to ensure the correct name. We should update this at the very least to actually match the method name we're in setUpBeforeEachTest.
Can we add comments here to detail what these warnings are? It makes it easier in the future to know why we're allowing these.

In these start server calls do we need to ensure we're waiting for the config updates to complete? Something like:  server.waitForConfigUpdateInLogUsingMark(Collections.singleton(appName), false/true, "CWWKT0016I:.*myAppName.*");
Usually we add a server != null check here as well.
Can this be removed?
